relatedanime.anime: NG Knight Ramune & 40 EX: Biku Biku Triangle Ai no Arashi Daisakusen

anime.description: Lamune is an ordinary 4th grade boy who loves playing video. He buys one from a peddler girl (and helps her sell the rest). At home, he plays the game called "King Sccasher" & beats it. The peddler girl then comes out of the TV screen and asks for his help, calling him "The Blood Relative of the Chosen Hero Lamuness" or Lamuness for short. She is Princess Milk and takes him to Hara-Hara World where his role is to revive the Guardian Knights... starting with King Sccasher. To do this, he had to find an unlock the shrine which held Tama-Q... a robot who became Lamuness` Advisor Robot. Normally worn on Lamuness` shoulder, Tama-Q, when fed a coin of a Guardian Knight, coughs up a capsule which releases that Knight. All of the Knights are free-thinking mechas except for King Sccasher which is piloted by Lamuness. Opposing Lamuness is Don Harumage and his minions Da Cider and Lesuka. Later, Lesuka and Da Cider sort of defect to the good guys. Da Cider also tells really bad puns (DAJARE). A fun giant-robot series. Note that "Lamune & 40 EX" and "Lamune & 40 DX" are OAV series following the TV series... Source: Anime Pocket Guide Description

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: robot helper
tag.description: In a http://anidb.net/t2846 [science fiction] setting, the robot helper is, in a comedic sense, pretty much equivalent to what the "cute comic relief http://anidb.net/t1835 [animal sidekick]" is in a fantasy setting. The usually small machine has artificial intelligence, enabling it to support their owner / master with advice or help with menial tasks. http://anidb.net/t1278 [Androids] should not be considered robot helpers since these are far more complex; use the android tag instead.

tag.name: blimp
tag.description: An blimp or dirigible balloon is a type of aerostat or lighter-than-air aircraft that can navigate through the air under its own power. Aerostats gain their lift from large gas bags filled with a lifting gas that is less dense than the surrounding air.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: fairy tale
tag.description: This anime is either based on or contains parts of fairy tales. Usually those parts are highly modified or twisted when compared with the original source.

tag.name: super robot
tag.description: These robots tend to have almost semi-magical attacks, which seem impossible or non-realistic, and/or perform non-realistic transformation sequences where they seem to gain/lose mass and utterly change their form, even if it means making their super-hard armour bend like plastic sheets.

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: isekai
tag.description:
An isekai story is one in which the lead characters are transferred to and become stuck or trapped in another world, one completely different from the one they lived in up until the transfer. The new world is commonly a http://anidb.net/t2628 [fictional world], such as a http://anidb.net/t2838 [parallel world] or http://anidb.net/t2839 [virtual world] (other fictional world types can also apply). What defines the isekai genre is that the characters are sent to another world, often but not always a parallel one, and they generally cannot come back permanently without meeting a highly specific goal. In order to adapt to their new environment, they must use the abilities and knowledge brought from their former world as well as any that may have been bestowed upon them by their brave new world. In some cases, they will seek and eventually find a way to return; in others, they will gleefully embrace their new life. http://anidb.net/a144 [Inuyasha] is an example where isekai applies to a fictional world that is not also a parallel or virtual world. http://anidb.net/ch7246 [Higurashi Kagome] climbs down an ancient well at her grandfather`s shrine and is transported to feudal Japan (time travel). While she eventually gains the physical ability to travel back and forth between her time period and feudal Japan, her bonds and responsibilities to feudal Japan tie her there until they are ultimately resolved. For clarity, below is an illustrative example where isekai is applied to a non-fictional, non-parallel, non-virtual world.
* The main characters are from Earth. One day, they are abducted by Nazis from Mars (alternate "world") are brought back to their Martian base. The main characters are trapped on Mars. Their only escape is to defeat the Nazis and steal their spaceship to return to Earth (specific goal required to escape); they are left to thier own devices, with no prospect of help from Earth, and no way to contact Earth.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: sexual humour
tag.description: Sexual humour is prevalent in this anime. It often involves cheeky or crude sexual language, with innuendos and jokes about the female or male genitalia. Often, such anime also have http://anidb.net/t2856 [ecchi] elements to them.

episode.title: シュパーン! キングスカッシャー復活
Shupan! King Sccasher Returns
Shupaan! King Sccasher Fukkatsu
episode.summary: After 4th grader Baba Ramune beats a video game he bought from a cute and mysterious girl, he is transported to Harahara World, where he is revealed to be Lamuness, the one destined to defeat the great warlock Don Harmage! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 交代劇! ひび割れた愛と友情
Role Reversal; the Cracks of Love and Friendship
Koutaigeki! Hibiwareta Ai to Yuujou
episode.summary: Two more Lithographs remain, as the group travel to a planet where they are cursed to fight each other- will they ever recover? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホイホイ城崩壊! さらばタマQ
The Collapse of Hoy-Hoy Castle! Farewell Tama-Q
Hoy-Hoy Jou Houkai! Saraba Tama-Q
episode.summary: The battle concludes as a combined attack finally destroys Don Harmage… or does it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ポッキンシティは腹ペコだ!
Pokkin City is Starving!
Pokkin City wa Harapeko da!
episode.summary: In search of the eight Guardian Knights, Ramune, along with Milk and Cocoa, venture to Pokking City using an ancient scroll as their guide. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迷って迷ってホラミッド!
We`re Lost! Lost in the Horramid!
Mayotte Mayotte Horramido
episode.summary: The crew finds themselves in a deadly maze, with a Guardian Knight in the center- will they recover it before Da Cider and Lesqua attack? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風に舞う! お花畑は危険地帯
The Dance of the Wind! The Field of Flowers is a Danger Zone!
Kaze ni Maru! Ohanabateke wa Kiken Chitai
episode.summary: The last Lithograph, all that is needed to defeat the evil forces- will Ramune and company get it before all hope is lost. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウソかマコトか? ラムネス伝説
The Legend of Lamuness: Truth or Deception?
Uso ka Makoto ka? Lamuness Densetsu?
episode.summary: Secrets are revealed that will forever change the fight for Harahara World! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダブルダブルでイースカー!?
Is it OK to Double-Double?
Double-Double de Iisukaa!?
episode.summary: Twins can be troublesome, yet rewarding; parallel to Ramune’s wins and Da Cider’s losses. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 輝け! 守護騎士コンテスト
Shine! The Guardian Knight Contest
Kagayake! Shugokishi Contest
episode.summary: The gang decides to take a break this week and hold a competition seeing who is the best Guardian Knight through recapping their previous adventures. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゼンマイだらけのギアシティ!
Gear City is Full of Wind-Up Springs
Zenmai Darake no Gear City
episode.summary: In Geartown, Ramune befriends a pretty woman named Soda, whose true intentions are more vile than what first appears… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 突入ホイホイ城! 愛の戦士たち
Storming Into Hoy-Hoy Castle, We Are the Soldiers of Love!
Totsunyuu Hoy-Hoy Jou! Ai no Senshi Tachi
episode.summary: The fight for Harahara World continues with the invasion of Hoi Poi Castle! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: テントチ塔! 海中島の戦い
Tentochi Tower! The Battle on the Island in the Middle of the Sea
Tentochi Tou! Umi Naka Jima no Tatakai
episode.summary: A series of trials await Ramune, Milk and Cocoa, who are all tested in their own abilities to obtain the next shard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 走れラムネス! 童話の森のワナ
Run Lamuness! The Traps in the Forest of Fairy Tales
Hashire Lamuness! Douwa no Mori no Wana
episode.summary: Milk’s favorite fairy tale growing up was Snow White- after eating an apple, she now is Snow White unless Ramune can cure her before the sun goes down! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 40集う! 熱血パワーよ永遠に
The Gathering of the 40! Be Forever, Hot Blood Power!
40 Tsudou! Nekketsu Power yo Eien ni
episode.summary: In its darkest hour, the fate of the Dokidoki Space lies on the few who dare oppose its cruelest foes. The end is in sight for Ramune and company. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正義は力だ! セイントボム
The Power of Justice! The Saint Bomb
Seigi no Chikara da! Saint Bomb
episode.summary: Now adjusting to his powers, Ramune is given new weapons to fight with, only to be interrupted when Da Cider and Lesqua suddenly attack! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高だミャー! タマQ... その愛
It`s the Greatest! Tama-Q, This is Love!
Saikou da myaa! Tama-Q... Sono Ai
episode.summary: Upon entering the Annakonna Gate, Tama-Q reunites with his girlfriend causing an internal conflict regarding loyalty, while Don Harmage enforces harsher consequences upon Da Cider and Lesqua, leading to a truly epic confrontation! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガハハ! ゴクロー山の爆笑扇
Hahaha! The Laughter Fan of Mount Gokuroo
Gahaha! Gokurousan no Bakushou Sen
episode.summary: Continuing their quest, Ramune and the Princesses embark toward a city where nobody can stop laughing! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 代理戦争!? 命をかけたギャグ
Do You Bet Your Life to a Proxy War Gag?
Dairi Sensou!? Inochi o Kaketa Gag
episode.summary: In pursuit of the second shard, a truly epic pun battle between Ramune and Da Cider ensues! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 晴れ姿! 三人娘の聖なる力
The Beauty of Victory! The Holy Power of the Three Maidens
Haresugata! San-nin Musume no Seinaru Chikara
episode.summary: The three sisters of legend reunite as Da Cider faces off against Ramune. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見っけた! アンナモンコンナ門
We Found Annamonkonna Gate!
Mitsketa! Annamonkonna-mon
episode.summary: Strange things happen when the weather gets cold- dreams mix with reality, and snow hides the truth upon the barren land… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 必死の反撃! ダ・サイダー散る
Hisshi no Hangeki! Da Cider Chiru
Hisshi no Hangeki! Da Cider Chiru
episode.summary: The showdown continues as Ramune tries to free Da Cider from Don Harmage’s evil curse! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 登場! クイーンサイダロン
The Grand Entrance of Queen Cideron!
Toujou! Queen Cideron
episode.summary: Da Cider’s newly formed plan goes into motion, giving Don Harmage a strong new weapon to combat Ramune and crew! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 必殺!? 破壊ニンジャ武芸帖
The Final Blow? The Techniques of the Destruction Ninja
Hissatsu!? Hakai Ninja Bugeichou
episode.summary: The quest continues, with Ramune and the princesses split up from Da Cider and Lesqua, as all search for the next shard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハワイイ島のカメカメカ大王
Kamekameka The Great of Hawaii
Hawaii Tou no Kamekameka Daiou
episode.summary: On course to the island of Hawayee, Ramune and crew must face Da Cider and his newly acquired Queen Cideron! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リューグー村は老人パワー!?
Dragonpalace Village Has Elderly Power?
Ryuuguu Mura wa Roujin Power!?
episode.summary: Finding a surprising landmark in the ocean, the crew travels to a village full of elderly people, a princess, and a corrupt madman behind it all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヘビメタコ裏切りのバラード
Heavy Metal-ko: The Ballad of Betrayal
Heavy Metal-ko Uragari no Ballad
episode.summary: The search for the shards begins as Hebi Metako’s loyalty is put to the test… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒック! 本音ジュースにご用心
Hic! Beware of the Juice of Truth
Hikku! Honne Juice ni Goyoujjin
episode.summary: Urusailles- a portside city with a “truth juice” epidemic at hand- causes conflict between Ramune and Milk over his skills as a hero. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バンビの頂上になぞなぞの嵐!
The Storm of Trivia on The Great Wall
Banri no Choujou ni Nazonazo no Arashi
episode.summary: The adventure continues, when the second Guardian Knight is found in a village full of deadly riddles! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アララ? 寝ぼけて寝ぼけて海の上
What? We`re Half Asleep, Half Asleep, and then We`re on the Sea
Arara! Nebokete Nebokete Umi no Ue
episode.summary: Whilst sleepwalking around, Ramune and Milk recount their journey so far, while Cocoa finds the next location in their quest. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まだ続くの!? 破壊戦士現わる
It`s Not Over! The Destruction Knights Appear
Mada Tsuzuku no!? Hakai Senshi Arawaru
episode.summary: With the confirmation that Don Harmage is alive, Cocoa learns of a way to destroy him forever! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ほらっホラー! 枯れ木の森の怪
Here it is, Horror! The Mystery in the Forest of the Dead
Hora Horror! Kareki no Mori no Kai
episode.summary: Now with half the shards, the indicator leads them to an area with 4 planets- the first being straight out of a horror movie! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱血!? カンカン村でアッチッチ
Hot Blood!? Kankan Village is Hot Hot Hot!
Nekketsu!? Kankan Mura de Atchichi
episode.summary: The desert sure is hot when Milk wants Ice Cream, Ramune is attacked by Da Cider, and a corrupt leader holds a town’s precious water hostage for noodle bowls! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大決戦! 燃えろラムネス
The Great Decisive Battle! Burn, Lamuness!
Daikessen! Moero Lamuness
episode.summary: The Eight Lithographs have been collected. It is time for the final battle to commence. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リトルロマンス... 君の名は!?
Little Romance... What is Your Name?
Little Romance... Kimi no Nawa?
episode.summary: Hsiabetta, one of the Four Destroyer Kings challenges Ramune and crew to a duel for the Lithograph they seek. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パカッ! 頭に花さくニャイル河
Pop! Flowers are Blooming on Heads Along the River Nyile!
Paka! Atami ni Hana Saku Nyile Gawa
episode.summary: Lesqua reunites with an old friend in hopes to destroying King Squasher once and for all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワナワナ! 逆襲のダ・サイダー
Shiver! The Counterattack of Da Cider
Wanawana! Gyakushuu no Da Cider
episode.summary: Things fall apart as Ramune and crew fall victim to traps of Da Cider’s making, leading to an incredible battle in a dangerous arena! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガンバレー! ミルクの子守り歌
Good Luck! Milk`s Lullabye
Gambatte! Milk no Komoriuta
episode.summary: Milk gets lost in a prehistoric world enslaving lizards all around- Can Ramune put an end to this? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美人はどっち? レスカ対ココア
Who is The Pretty Girl? Lesuka Versus Cocoa
Bijin wa Dotchi? Lesuka Tai Cocoa
episode.summary: In a city where no humans are allowed at the temple, the few exceptions are those entered in a beauty contest- including Cocoa and Lesqua! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Opening 1
Opening 2
Ending 1
Ending 2
